pros: Affordability. Life University’s tuition and books may be less expensive than competing schools. Convenience. Take classes on your schedule, within a timeframe that lets you balance work, family and life. Support. You won’t go on this journey alone. Our dedicated faculty and staff will be with you every step of the way. Faculty. Our professors care about you and want you to succeed in the classroom and beyond. Whether it’s on-screen or on campus, we’ll help you devise an educational plan that works for you.
cons: I wish if it has more academic programs.

review_title: In the end you won’t be happy
pros: Nice location with a beautiful campus.
cons: Poor pay Horrible benefits Low work life balance Poor management Favoritism Very low room for growth

pros: Great restaurants nearby the school.
cons: Leadership Leadership Leadership!!! Not valuing employees.

pros: Great faculty, students and philosophy.
cons: The university does not provide adequate resources for students to learn nor for faculty to grow.

pros: Good sense of community; mission-driven; good people.
cons: Low mobility (for some); inconsistent communication

pros: Amazing people work and go to school there. Can get a degree for free basically.
cons: Low pay, high stress. Overall not worth my mental health

pros: There are some good people here that generally care for students. Free chiropractic care. Free tuition for self and immediate family (spouse/children).
cons: Lack of trust in leadership. Constant and unexpected policy and personnel changes.

pros: Health-focused, life first, flexibility in schedule
cons: Not a lot of growth potential

job_title: Technical Business Support in Marietta, GA
pros: Gain experience to various aspects of the organization which can be beneficial if you're deciding on what concentration you want to focus on.
cons: Little area to grow within the organization. This also includes compensation. The only way to get a raise is via position change which is rather rare.

pros: Beautiful campus, good collaboration with co-workers. Good students.
cons: Missing great opportunities to grow exponentially.

pros: Access to the gym. Beautiful campus
cons: limited upward mobility and low pay

pros: The company allowed workers to work from home during pandemic.
cons: Micromanaging provides a negative environment for staff.

pros: Relaxed working environment. Good Disability Services management

pros: Great relationship with students and co-workers, nice environment

review_title: Presents strong ethics, don't actually practice them
pros: Pretty campus, a few nice, hardworking employees
cons: Terrible passive aggressive management who only promote their 'buddies' aka kiss ups. Little chance of professional growth, pay is also based on how much management likes you personally,  terrible morale, terrible turnover because people don't feel valued, and many superior/subordinate and employee/student love affairs. If you are liked by management you can write your own ticket - come in whenever,  leave early,  watch tv all day,  and do the very bare minimum and still be loved and rewarded!

pros: The work is fast paced at time. The people who work at the Library are awesome people and fun to work with.
cons: It seems to many that there is ABSOLUTELY no upward mobility. Many of the students are quite rude and seem to have a great deal of entitlement.

pros: I had a few great coworkers, it is a beautiful campus, there were great perks (free chiropractic care, free gym, free undergrad tuition, etc.)
cons: Narcissist President that micromanages so it's not run efficiently or effectively.  They have amazing values, but don't actually live them.  HR department is a joke.

job_title: Sports Information Student Assistant in Marietta, GA
pros: Most Coaches are easy to work with, athletes are also excited to be highlighted and acknowledged. Laid back environment. There is a bit of interest growing in the university from an undergrad standpoint.
cons: Maybe too laid back. Needs more structure, organization amongst the athletics department. There’s no long/short term goals that are to be met. Lack of media knowledge due to there being no media programs at the university.

job_title: Graduate Assistant Athletic Trainer in Marietta, GA
pros: classes are relatively easy, and mostly review in most aspects.  also get to work with heavy contact teams like rugby, which is better experience for quick acute care and management of injuries.
cons: it may be a part time job experience, but you will work full time hours while in season with traveling and tournaments are taking place.

job_title: Director Enrollment Recruitment in Powder Springs, Cobb, GA
pros: Fast paced, never a boring day! Great students and co-workers. This is a small university in the heart of Marietta. The campus is beautiful and everyone is friendly. I liked the safe environment and the health conscious minded people that work and study at LIFE. Good place to surround yourself with positive people.
cons: I recommend this employer to anyone interested in working in higher education.

pros: It's a very educational environment and I like the diversity of the students and professors
cons: Some of the professors are not giving you enough teaching and you need to figure out yourself.

review_title: Best low/no stress job I've ever had
pros: Atmosphere of helpfulness and dedication. Students show a true desire to be the best they can be. Staff and faculty share the common goals of advancing the schools core values.
cons: Healthcare benefits lagging behind comparably sized companies
